alert.note: Alert for Southwest Phillips (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 27 at 12:31PM MST until January 28 at 5:00AM MST by NWS Glasgow
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 AM MST SATURDAY... ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 5 PM SATURDAY TO 2 PM MST MONDAY... * WHAT...For the Winter Weather Advisory, snow. Additional snow accumulations of up to two inches. For the Wind Chill Advisory, very cold wind chills expected. Wind chills as low as 25 below zero. * WHERE...Southwest Phillips County. * WHEN...For the Winter Weather Advisory, until 5 AM MST Saturday. For the Wind Chill Advisory, from 5 PM Saturday to 2 PM MST Monday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 30 minutes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Any slush or water on roadways will quickly freeze this evening making for additional slippery road conditions tonight.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. Use caution while traveling outside. Wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
